com.twitter.common.application
Class ActionController

java.lang.Object
  com.twitter.common.application.ActionController
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionRegistry
public class ActionController
extends java.lang.Object
implements ActionRegistry

A ActionRegistry that provides a execute() method that will ensure all registered actions are executed in the reverse order they were registered.

Constructor Detail

Method Detail

addAction

public <E extends java.lang.Exception,T extends ExceptionalCommand<E>> void addAction(T action)
Registers an action to execute during execute(). It is an error to call this method after calling execute().

Specified by:
addAction in interface ActionRegistry
Parameters:
action - the action to add to the list of actions to execute during execution

execute

public void execute()
Executes an application lifecycle stage by executing all registered actions. This method can be called multiple times but will only execute the registered actions the first time. This sends output to System.out because logging is unreliable during JVM shutdown, which this class may be used for.
